[To the Developer - Use this section to combine your app's functions with various buttons, describe your app, describe the group behind the app, and provide basic details/instructions to end users]

This area is dedicated to providing a description of your app. It's generally encouraged to include the following information:

  1. A description of your app
  2. Why this app is needed [the app's purpose]
  3. Who this app is intended for [the app's audience]
  4. Any other pertinent information you may find necessary

 This App displays a message when the user clicks the button on the left.

This App displays a message when the user clicks the button on the left.

To use this template, clone/copy this directory and open the included files in your editor of choice.

Expand All | Collapse All

  • Information and Permissions

  • Administrator Button Permission Settings

    The Admin can set permissions for each button.
    • Enable Button - allows anyone to run if enabled and no one to run if disabled
    • Enable Normal User - allows a normal user to run the button or not
    • Run without Warning - if disabled a warning message will be presented
    Permission Logic
    • Anyone run?
      • If NO --- STOP and THROW a MESSAGE
      • If yes -- keep going
    • GET STATE --
      • IF Admin, SKIP to "GLOBAL CAUTION" step
      • IF not admin, continue
        • CAN normal user run??
        • IF yes --- continue
        • IF no --- throw message and STOP
      • IS GLOBAL caution to the wind?
        • IF yes, SKIP to RUN
        • IF no -- CONTINUE
      • Is BUTTON caution?
        • IF yes -- THROW MESSAGE and STOP
        • IF no -- CONTINUE
    • RUN

[To the Developer - Use this section to describe in greater technical detail how your app works]

This area is dedicated to providing technical details about the app. Provide the mechanics of how the app works. Generally speaking, if you are making changes to a user's computer, it's best to detail those changes in a completely transparent manner.

Include more details than what would appear on the "Home" tab and be free to use more technical language in the process.

Technical Details

Include, in specific wording, what your app does. Some questions you may want to answer include: What files does your app change? In what programming language is your app written? Are there any resources you've used to create your app? Feel free to include as much detail as you want.

Script Source Code

cdpbutton1: onclick="javascript:runapp('displaymessage.js')"

[To the Developer - Use this section to detail any associated costs with your app.]

No Cost to You.

All SnapBack Apps are free for both business and personal use, provided that the SnapBack Platform is "hand installed", by a user and not "mass installed". However, for some apps they may be working with or modify another application, such as Microsoft Word, which is obviously not free. Sometimes we might independently offer that application to you with a link to a separate page. If and when we offer you the software, we warrant that to our best ability, we've fully disclosed which products in that category are best, the least cost prices with links, along with any dissenting opinions from contributors like you.

For all our users, contributors, attributable sources, and other companies, we've prepared an easy to understand page that explains all our Policies, Complete Terms, and Conditions of our SnapBack Apps, Platform, website, and our SnapBack Apps Factory where they are produced. Together, this page, the FAQ, and the discussions of users, contributors, and CDP should convince you that this project is worthy of your full support.

[To the Developer - DO NOT EDIT - The various Committees will edit this section during your app's approval process.]

Each Committee has signed off on their part. For more detail of each committees' policies and procedures, visit their home pages.
